meanings.definition: Present participle of lie (to make an untrue statement with intent to deceive)
meanings.sent1: She was caught lying about her grades.
meanings.sent2: He always tells the truth, never lying to anyone.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried lying about eating the cookies, but the crumbs gave him away.
meanings.sent4: Her web of lies was slowly unraveling, exposing her deceitful lying.
meanings.sent5: The detective knew he was lying when his eyes darted around nervously.

meanings.sent1: The lying politician lost the trust of the people.
meanings.sent2: She could not believe his lying words.
meanings.sent3: The lying cat pretended innocence after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The lying advertisement promised results that were too good to be true.
meanings.sent5: His lying behavior was evident in the inconsistencies of his story.

meanings.definition: Adverb: in a horizontal position or direction
meanings.sent1: She was lying on the grass, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: The books were lying neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat was lying lazily in the sunbeam, purring contentedly.
meanings.sent4: The fallen leaves were lying undisturbed on the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The keys were lying forgotten on the table.
